Ted starts with $200. He buys 3 books for 16 dollars each and 3 pencils for 6 dollars each. He also buys 2 backpacks for 20 dollars each, 6 erasers for 1.5 dollars each, and 4 ballpoint pens for 8 dollars each. How much did he spend in total?

Shiloh is 44 years old today. In 7 years, he will be three times as old as his nephew. His nephew is 3 years younger than his son. The current age of his son is one-third the age of his wife. His daughter is 20 years younger than his wife. How old is his daughter now?

Mattison is 60 inches tall. His two-story house is 7 times as high as he is. The floor to the ceiling on the first floor is thrice as high as he is. The height from the second floor's floor to the roof of Mattison's house equals one-seventh the height of Mary's building. If each story of Mary's building averages 105 inches in height and each story has 6 windows, how many windows are there in Mary's building?

Brenda invested $300 into a scheme that accumulates simple interest at the rate of three-quarters of the original amount per year. After 3 years, the total amount she receives is one-third of her monthly salary. John's monthly salary is $2,000 more than Brenda's. Mary's monthly salary is twice that of John's. How much does Mary earn per month?

Brendan has a bag of marbles with 10 inside. He tripped over a pebble while carrying it and dropped half of them. He scrambled to search for them but only came up with 3. When he went back home, he inspected the marbles further. One of them he picked up wasn't a marble, but actually a bead so he got rid of it. Brendan ended up with a number of marbles that was one-quarter of Mary's marbles. The average number of marbles between Mary and John is 42. Ellie has 14 fewer marbles than John. How many marbles does Ellie have?

Gary bought a boat for $9000. Over the first year, it depreciated by 30%. The second year, it depreciated another 30%. The third year, it depreciated by 20%. The loss in value of the boat after three years is half of Gary's annual earnings. What is Gary's total earnings over the three years?

Melanie found a blueprint online for a toothpick sculpture she wanted to make, which requires 200 toothpicks. Melanie’s sister gave her 10 toothpicks, and her amount of toothpicks given by her brother is 10 less than twice the amount her sister gave her. Additionally, the number of toothpicks her sister gave her is half as many as her older sister gave her. Melanie's mom uses toothpicks to serve sandwiches for lunch. Melanie began saving these toothpicks and has saved 10 toothpicks each week for the past 12 weeks. If she continues saving toothpicks at the same rate, how many more weeks will it take her to collect 200 toothpicks?

A real estate agent has spent $5 on each newspaper ad, $7 on each flyer ad, and $75 on each television ad. He bought 50 newspaper ads, 25 flyer ads, and 15 television ads. The total amount spent on all the ads is one-seventh of the real estate company's weekly earnings. Given that there are 4 weeks in a month, what is the real estate company's monthly earnings?

Seth gave half of his stickers to Luis. Luis used half of the stickers and gave the rest to Kris. Kris kept 9 of the stickers and gave the remaining 7 stickers to Rob. Seth initially had 26 fewer stickers than Mary. John had three times as many stickers as Mary. The average number of stickers among Mary, John, and Alice was 230. How many stickers did Alice have?

Tommy is fundraising for his charity by selling brownies for $3 a slice, cheesecakes for $4 a slice, bread for $5 a slice, and egg tarts for $6 each. If Tommy sells 43 brownies, 23 slices of cheesecake, 35 slices of bread, and 17 egg tarts, how much more money does he need to raise to reach $1000?

Carl has a cane that is half as long as he is tall. Carl is one foot taller than his brother, Ned. Ned is two feet shorter than his cousin, Isabel. Mary is six feet taller than Carl's cane. The height of the basketball hoop is twice Mary's height. A tree is seven feet taller than the basketball hoop. If Isabel is 7 feet tall, how tall is the tree, in feet?

Dylan attended a wedding where there were 100 guests at the reception. Each guest brought a plate of 15 cookies. The bride decided to give 1/2 of the cookies to the church next door as a thank you for helping in the wedding reception. Each person in the church next door received 15 cookies. The number of people at the nearby elementary school was 6 times the number of people in the church. The number of people at the middle school was 270 more than at the elementary school. The number of people at the university was 16 times that of the middle school. How many people were at the university?

James receives 80 emails per day. 20% of those emails and an additional 10% of the emails do not require any response or are rejects. He responds to the rest of them. James earns $0.4 for each email he responds to. The income he earns from responding to emails in a 5-day work week is equal to one fifth of Mary's daily wage. What is Mary's daily wage?

A news website publishes an average of 20 political and weather news articles every day. Its sister company publishes an average of 10 business news articles daily. Assuming February has 28 days, March has 31 days, and April has 30 days, and each article receives 26 views, calculate the total number of views for all articles published by the two websites across these three months.

The ice cream parlor was offering a deal, buy 2 scoops of ice cream, get 1 scoop free. Each scoop cost $1.50. If Erin had $6.00, she bought all her ice cream. She then sold the ice cream for $2 per scoop, and the money she gained was one-third of her daily allowance. Mary's daily allowance is $10 less than Erin's. How much is Mary's daily allowance?

James likes to check the coin return of the vending machine for change. One day he finds a quarter, two nickels, and 7 dimes. If 1 dollar equals 100 cents, John has 95 cents more than James. Mary has 7 times the money John has. Together, Alice and Mary have 69 dollars. How much money does Alice have?

Beatrice bought ten packets of crayons for her Art class. Six of the packets had eight pieces of colors each, and the other four packets had sixteen pieces of colors each. Each crayon color costs $12. Beatrice initially had $2000, and after buying the crayons, the remaining amount of money was one-fifteenth of her monthly salary. What is Beatrice’s monthly salary?

Jen decides to travel to 3 different countries. He has to pay $400 for the supplies he needs, in total. The tickets for travel cost, in total, 50% more than the supplies. Additionally, the accommodation costs for the travel are 3 times the cost of the supplies. The total travel expenses amount to one-quarter of Jen's monthly salary. If Eily's monthly salary is $3200 higher than that of Jen, what is Eily's monthly salary?

Mark plants a beanstalk below his second-story window, which is 20 feet off the ground. The beanstalk doubles its height every day. If the beanstalk starts out 4 feet tall, on the third day after planting it, Mark cuts off the part of the beanstalk that has grown above his window to sell. The beanstalk sells for $3 per foot. The money Mark makes from selling the beanstalk is one fourteenth of his daily wage. How much does Mark earn per day?

Lana is brewing cups of tea for her friends. She has 27 cups, and she divides these into 3 rows. In each row, she creates equal amounts of chamomile and mint tea cups. She then uses the remaining cups to brew a total of 15 cups of cinnamon tea. If brewing one cup of mint tea costs $2, one cup of chamomile tea costs $3, and one cup of cinnamon tea costs $4, how much is the value of mint tea, cinnamon tea, and chamomile tea in one row?

Sandy walked from Holloway Shores to Sun Valley Shores for 8 hours on a particular day. She also walked half as many hours on the second day as she walked on the first day, to Hollock Valley Shores. On the third day, Sandy walked four times the duration of the second day to reach Village A. On the fourth day, she walked 6 hours less than the third day to get to Village B. On the fifth day, she walked half the time of the fourth day to reach Village C. Calculate the total time Sandy took to walk over the five days in minutes.

Six years ago, when Noah was half as old as Cera, the population of Chile was half what it is now. Currently, Cera is 46 years old. If the population of Chile six years ago was 3000 times the age of Noah, calculate the current population of Chile which is now one third of the current population of Sweden. Additionally, the current population of Norway is 130,000 less than that of Sweden, with a male to female ratio of 3:7. What is the current male population in Norway?

Ben has 4 tubes of blue paint and 3 tubes of yellow paint. Jasper has half as many tubes of blue paint as Ben, and three times as many tubes of yellow paint as Ben. Mary has three times as many tubes of blue paint as Jasper, and one more tube of yellow paint than Jasper. John has four times as many tubes of blue paint as Mary and two more tubes of yellow paint than Mary. Ellie has one-third as many tubes of blue paint as John, and four more tubes of yellow paint than John. How many tubes of paint does Ellie have in total?

John is raising money for a school trip. He has applied for help from the school, which has decided to cover half the cost of the trip. John has $50, his sister gave him $30, and his brother gave him $20. The trip costs $300. The amount John is still missing is one-third of Mary's weekly allowance. How much is Mary's weekly allowance?

Lorie earns $10 per hour. Karen earns twice what Lorie earns. Mary earns $12 more per hour than Karen. John earns three times what Mary earns per hour. Ellie earns $20 less per hour than John. If Ellie works 3 hours per day, how much does she earn in two days?

There are 10000 gallons of water in a pool. Using a water pump, Anthony and his father fill a tank with half the amount of water in the pool. They use water from the tank to water their vegetable garden. If the tank is emptied at a rate of 500 gallons of water per day, and after 6 days, 2000 gallons of water are added back into the tank, how much is the remaining water in the tank worth if 1 gallon of water weighs 3.8 kilograms and 1 kilogram of water costs $0.02?

The Smith family is preparing for summer and needs to fill their swimming pool. The pool company has instructed them to measure the pool’s volume and then multiply it by 5.9 to find out how many gallons of water are required. The company charges $0.10 per gallon to fill the pool. Mr. Smith measured the pool and found that it is 14 feet wide, 25 feet long, and 4 feet deep. As the pool needs to be refilled three times a month due to regular water changes, the monthly cost of filling the pool is one-fifth of the Smith family’s monthly expenditures. The Smith family’s monthly income is $20,000. How much money does the Smith family have left each month after expenses?

Ali is a dean of a private school where he teaches one class which has a capacity of 120 students. Each student is equipped with one pencil case and three pencils. The cost of one pencil case is $5 and one pencil is $1. John is also a dean of a public school that has two classes, each having 1/8 the capacity of Ali's class. What is the total value of all the pencil cases and pencils combined for both schools?

A builder works for 4 weeks every month and for 6 days every week. If he gets paid $50 every day and receives an additional $200 as a site allowance per month, how much does he earn if he works for a year, knowing that this amount is one quarter of Mary’s annual salary? If John’s annual salary is $2340 less than Mary's, what is John’s annual salary?

When Freda cooks canned tomatoes into sauce, they lose half their volume. Each 16 ounce can of tomatoes that she uses contains three tomatoes. Freda’s last batch of tomato sauce made 32 ounces of sauce. Each tomato costs $3, and the money Freda spent on tomatoes was one-twelfth of her daily wage. A bicycle costs $2592. How many days of wages does Freda need to buy one bicycle?

A singer has 50 microphones that he wants to arrange in pairs on a stage. While making the arrangement, he realizes that 20% of the microphones won't find any space to fit in after arranging the rest in pairs. After arranging the microphones, he performed for 17 minutes on each pair of microphones. If the singer earns $24 per minute of performance, and the money he earned from this performance is one-fortieth of the total concert ticket revenue, what is the total concert ticket revenue?

Peter has 4 boxes with the same number of chocolate bars in each, while Martha has 7 boxes with the same number of chocolate bars in each. If Peter and Martha have totals of 64 and 56 chocolate bars respectively, then one box of Peter’s chocolates plus one box of Martha’s chocolates totals one-fifth of Mary’s total number of chocolates. John has 30 fewer chocolates than Mary. The total number of chocolates Alice and John have together is 170. How many chocolates does Alice have?

John is a carpenter. For his friend Ali, he manufactured 4 wooden tables for $20 each and 2 roof frames for $10 each. Additionally, he made 8 chairs at $5 each, 2 sofas at $30 each, and 3 wardrobes at $40 each. How much does Ali have to pay John?

If Chester eats 3 eggs a day for 30 days and then increases it to 5 eggs a day for another 30 days, and the cost of a dozen eggs is $36, calculate Chester’s monthly salary if the total cost of the eggs for 60 days equals one-quarter of his weekly wage, and he works 4 weeks per month.

Mason likes eating carrots. If he eats 4 carrots each on weekdays and 5 carrots each on Saturday and Sunday, and each carrot costs $2.5, with 4 weeks in a month. Given Mason earns $4000 per month, how much money does he have left after spending on carrots each month?

Joseph had 3 times as many notebooks as Martha. Mary had 3 more notebooks than Joseph, and John's notebooks were 3 times as many as Mary's. Martha decided she needed more notebooks and then bought 5 more for a total of 7 notebooks. At $4 per notebook, how much is the total value of the notebooks that Martha and John now have?

Jada, Rory, Eily, and Kora make clay dishes to present as art for their school project. Jada makes twice as many clay dishes as Rory, while Rory makes 20 more clay dishes than Kora, and Eily makes half as many clay dishes as Kora. If Kora made 20 dishes, considering that each clay dish requires 3 kilograms of clay and 1 kilogram of clay costs 0.5 dollars, how much money in total did they spend on clay for all the dishes?

A customer’s loyalty card at a store gives them rewards of $1 off their next purchase for every $20 they spend. Their last shopping trip, they spent $80. This shopping trip, they spent $43, used their rewards, and applied a coupon that took twice the amount of rewards off the price. The amount the customer paid on this shopping trip is one-third of Mary's daily wage. A washing machine costs $7254. Mary works 26 days a month. How many months of wages does Mary need to save to buy the washing machine?

Nissa hires 60 seasonal workers to play elves in her department store's Santa village. A third of the elves quit after children vomit on them, then 10 of the remaining elves quit after kids kick their shins. Additionally, 5 more elves leave due to the end of their contracts. The daily wage for each remaining elf is $130. The total daily wages for all remaining elves equal one-sixth of the department store's daily revenue. What is the store's total daily revenue?

Ali is a superstar counter who has won 22 medals for counting super fast. His friend Izzy is also a really good counter and has 5 less medals than Ali. John has 3 times the medals that Izzy has. Mary has 40 medals fewer than John. Eily has twice the number of medals as Mary. Together, all five of them have one-tenth the number of medals that have been given out for counting. How many medals have been given out for counting?

Liam is 16 years old now. Two years ago, Liam’s age was twice the age of Vince. Mary was 4 years older than Vince, John was twice as old as Mary, and Ellie was 6 years younger than John. How old is Ellie now?

James buys a ring for his bride-to-be. The diamond cost $600, the gold cost $300, and the platinum cost $200. He pays a 30% premium for it to be made. The total amount he paid was one-ninth of his monthly salary. John's monthly salary is $870 less than James's. How much does John earn each month?

Bobby takes a 30 min lunch and 2 15 minutes breaks per day at the office. His daily working hours are eight times the total duration of his lunch and breaks. Bobby earns $68 per hour. His earnings over 5 days amount to one-third of Mary's monthly salary. How much does Mary earn per month?

In a neighborhood, the number of rabbit pets is twelve less than the combined number of pet dogs and cats. Additionally, the number of pet hamsters exceeds the number of dogs by 22, the number of pet birds is half that of hamsters, and there are ten fewer pet pigs than birds. If there are two cats for every dog, and the number of dogs is 60, how many pets in total are in the neighborhood?

Jan has three times the number of pets as Marcia. Marcia has two more pets than Cindy. John has three times the number of pets as Cindy, and Mary has three more pets than John. Alice has one-third the number of pets as Mary. If Cindy has four pets, how many total pets do the six of them have?

Jonathan has 2/3 as many measuring spoons as measuring cups. If he has two dozen cups and gifts Pedro 6 measuring spoons for his birthday, John has 5 more measuring spoons and 4 fewer measuring cups than Jonathan does. Mary has 7 more measuring spoons than John and 2 fewer measuring cups than John. If one measuring spoon is worth 3 dollars and one measuring cup is worth 5 dollars, calculate the total value of Mary's utensils in dollars.

Katina has $3000 in her savings account. If she withdraws $100 from the account and deposits $300 every month, the amount left in the account after 2 years will be half of Mary’s monthly salary. The average of Mary's monthly salary and John's monthly salary is $13,000. What is John’s monthly salary?

Julie, Micah, and Mitchell sold 32 glasses of lemonade at their lemonade stand. Julie sold 14 glasses and the boys sold an equal number of glasses. How many more glasses did Julie sell than Micah is one-eighth of the number of glasses Mary sold. John sold 12 glasses fewer than Mary. Ellie and John together sold a total of 70 glasses of lemonade. How many glasses did Ellie sell?

Kenny is selling his Pokemon cards to buy a ticket to an amusement park, which costs $100. He has a collection of cards and plans to sell them for $1.5 each. He keeps 1/3 of them and, after buying the ticket, has $50 in spending money for the amusement park. His initial number of cards is 5 times the number of cards Eily has. John has 37 more cards than Eily. Mary has 4 times as many cards as John. How many cards does Mary have?

Rita hand-picks Junebugs off of her plants every summer. On Monday, she removed 39 Junebugs. On both Tuesday and Wednesday, she removed twice as many Junebugs as she did on Monday. Thursday she removed 48 and on Friday she removed 57. Rita removes on average 20 more Junebugs per day than Mary. The sum of the number of Junebugs that John and Mary remove per day is 100. For each Junebug removed, there is a reward of $0.7. What is the daily reward that John receives for removing Junebugs?

Mrs. Cruz is looking for a house that will not go beyond her $400,000 budget. She saw a property with a selling price of $350,000. Besides, the buyer has to pay a brokerage fee of 5% of the selling price, a transfer fee of 12% of the selling price, and a renovation fee of 7% of the selling price. The total cost of the house exceeds Mrs. Cruz's budget by an amount equal to 20 months of her salary. Mary earns $750 more per month than Mrs. Cruz. How much does Mary earn each month?

Anne purchased a box of sweets that contains 15 packs, and each pack has 60 pieces. She kept two packs for herself, gave three packs to her sister, two packs fewer than she gave to her sister to her younger sister, and four packs to her brother. She gave the remaining sweets equally among her 10 friends. How many pieces of sweets did each of her friends receive?

Tyler wants to buy a dictionary that costs $18, a dinosaur book that costs $13, two science fiction books each costing $15, an English book costing $10, three Chinese language books each costing $20, and a children's cookbook that costs $8. He has saved $14 from his allowance. If Tyler earns $5 per hour, how many hours does he have to work to afford all these books?

Movie A was one-fourth the length of Movie B. Movie B was 5 minutes longer than Movie C. Movie C was 1.25 hours. The length of Movie D was three times that of Movie A. Movie E was 12 minutes longer than Movie D. The total duration of Movies E and F was 3 hours. How many minutes long was Movie F?

Betsy, Donovan, Mary, and John made a meal together. Betsy's part took 18 minutes longer than Donovan's part. Mary's part took 20 minutes, and John's part took 30 minutes. The meal was made in 98 minutes. Additionally, the time Betsy spent bicycling today was three times the time she spent cooking. How many minutes did Betsy spend bicycling today?

Susan earns $5 every 10 minutes for an online task she does. If she works between 8 a.m. and 11 a.m. and pauses in between for half an hour, the amount of money she earns from the online task is one third of Thomas's daily wage. John's daily wage is $130 more than Thomas's, and Mary's daily wage is three times John's. How much does Mary earn per day?

A phone tree is used to contact families and relatives of Ali's deceased coworker. Ali decided to call 3 families. Then each family calls 3 other families, and so on. Making one call costs $3. The expenses for the calls during the fourth round amount to one-seventh of Ali's weekly salary. Considering there are 4 weeks in a month, how much is Ali's monthly salary?

In his training as a professional athlete, Tyson runs 5000 meters every day. However, his coach wants him to run 1/5 times more meters in a day. If he followed his coach's advice and trained for a month, the total distance he covered in June is one-sixth the distance from City A to City B. Assuming a car travels at a speed of 120 kilometers per hour and consumes 2 liters of fuel per hour, how many liters of fuel would the car need to travel from City A to City B?

A clothing store has 40 white shirts and 50 floral shirts. Half of the white shirts have collars, and 20 of the floral shirts have buttons. The number of floral shirts without buttons exceeds the number of white shirts without collars by an amount equal to one third of the number of gray shirts in the store. Gray shirts are priced at $20 each, and white shirts at $15 each. What is the total value of the gray and white shirts in the store?

The bakers at the Beverly Hills Bakery baked 200 loaves of bread on Monday morning. They sold 93 loaves in the morning and 39 loaves in the afternoon. A grocery store returned 6 unsold loaves. On Tuesday, the bakers baked three times as many loaves as the loaves left from Monday. On Wednesday, they baked a total amount equal to the combined total of Monday and Tuesday. On Thursday, the bakers baked 157 loaves fewer than on Wednesday. How many loaves did they bake on Thursday?

A DVD can be played 1000 times before it breaks. There are five DVDs in the public library. The first DVD has been played 356 times, the second DVD has been played 135 times. The third DVD has been played twice the number of times as the second DVD. The fourth DVD has been played 645 times. The fifth DVD has been played 200 times fewer than the fourth DVD. How many total times can all five DVDs be played before they break?

John fills a 6 foot by 4 foot pool that is 5 feet deep. It costs $.1 per cubic foot to fill. After filling the pool, John builds a house on top of it, and the cost of building the house is 278 times the cost of filling the pool. Then, John buys a car that costs $3450 more than the cost of building the house. The price of two cars equals the price of six bicycles. How much does one bicycle cost?

On Monday, Walt walked 4 miles. Tuesday, he walked 6 times as many miles as he walked on Monday. His total mileage Monday through Wednesday was 41 miles. How many miles did he walk on Wednesday? On Thursday, he walked twice as many miles as he did on Wednesday. He walked 22 miles more on Friday than on Thursday. The total mileage for Friday and Saturday was 70 miles. How many miles did he walk on Saturday?

At a restaurant, Juice Box A is 4 dollars. Juice Box B is 5 dollars more than Juice Box A. Juice Box C is 7 dollars more than Juice Box A. Juice Box D is 5 dollars more than Juice Box C. Juice Box E is 3 dollars more than Juice Box D. Mary buys 3 Juice Boxes E and 1 Juice Box B. How much does she spend in total?

Cindy's math and science books weigh 2 pounds each. Her French book weighs 4 pounds, and her English book weighs 3 pounds. Her history book weighs twice as much as her English book. Additionally, her physics book weighs 6 pounds and her politics book weighs 2 pounds. Her Chinese book weighs 1 pound less than her physics book. If Cindy carries all of her books at once, what will be the total weight of the books she is carrying?

Pancho walks 20 miles a day. Except on weekends when he walks 10 miles. Mary walks three times the distance that Pancho walks in a week. John walks 52 miles less than Mary in a week. Ellie cycles five times the distance John walks in a week. How many miles does Ellie cycle in a week?

James wants to hang crepe-paper streamers from his backyard fence for his birthday party. His backyard fence is a rectangle that measures 20 feet on the long side and 15 feet on the short side. The cost of 1 foot of crepe paper is $6, and James spent a total of $700 on crepe paper and cake. The cost of the cake was half of James's daily wage. How much is James's daily wage?

John rents his car out 10 times a month for 3 hours each time. He gets paid $25 an hour. If his car payment is $500 a month, the annual profit he makes on his car is equal to one-third of Mary's monthly salary. John's monthly salary is $3580 more than Mary's. What is John's monthly salary?

Will buys 15 oranges. When he gets home, he asks his 2 sons to wash as many oranges as they are years old. The oldest son is 8 years old, the youngest is half as old as the oldest. An orange costs $3, and the value of the unwashed oranges is $6 less than the daily allowance of the youngest son. The oldest son's daily allowance is twice that of the younger son. What is the total daily allowance of both sons?

Charlie has boots that are five times the size of Sophie's. John wears boots that are four sizes smaller than Charlie's, Mary wears boots that are eight sizes smaller than John's, and Ellie wears boots that are twice the size of Mary's. If Sophie wears size five boots, what is the average shoe size worn by these five individuals?

Mary buys 6 bags of M&Ms. The first bag has 300 M&Ms in it. The second bag has 12 more M&Ms than the first, and the third bag has a hole in it, so it only has half the number of M&Ms that the first bag had. The fourth bag contains four times the number of M&Ms in the third bag. The fifth bag has 200 fewer M&Ms than the fourth bag. The sixth bag has 146 more M&Ms than the fifth bag. How many M&Ms did Mary get in total?

Peter purchased 20 popsicles at $0.25 each. He also purchased 4 ice cream bars at $0.50 each. Additionally, he bought 4 loaves of bread at $2 each, 2 cakes at $5.50 each, and 7 egg tarts at $2 each. How much did he pay in total in dollars?

Cecelia went to the milk store and found out that a gallon jar costs $2 more than a half-gallon jar. If a gallon jar costs $5, she bought 10-gallon jars and 16 half-gallon jars. If Cecelia initially had $150, the remaining money after her purchase is a fifth of her daily salary. A washing machine costs $1820. How many days of salary does Cecelia need to buy a washing machine?

Leah just got a new kitten. Spaying her cost $200, her 3 vaccines cost $20 each, and the kitten broke 4 vases that cost $12 each. The kitten also had 5 grooming sessions, costing $12 each. Leah bought 12 pieces of clothing for the kitten, each costing $17. So far, the total cost of the kitten is one-quarter of Leah's weekly salary. What is Leah's weekly salary?

Lloyd has an egg farm. His chickens produce 252 eggs per day and he sells them for $2 per dozen. In a week, which is 7 days, and with a month being 4 weeks, the money Lloyd earns from selling eggs each month constitutes one-fifth of his monthly salary. Given that there are 12 months in a year, what is Lloyd's annual salary?

Lori needed 1 whole egg to make 2 deviled egg halves. She anticipates that each of her guests will eat 3 deviled egg halves and drink 2 cups of milk. If she is inviting 16 guests to her party, and the cost of 1 dozen eggs is $36 and 1 cup of milk costs $5, and the cost of eggs and milk is one-third of Lori’s daily salary. What is Lori’s daily salary?

A water tank is filled with 120 liters of water. Celine used 90 liters of water from the tank to water her small garden, 10 liters to mop the floor, and 5 liters to bathe her kitten. After that, she was able to collect rainwater that is twice as much as what was left in the tank. Now, the total weight of the water in the tank is half of Celine's weight, if 1 liter of water weighs 1 kilogram. What is Celine's weight in kilograms?

Denise and Daniel are reading the same book. Three days ago, Denise read 6 pages while Daniel read 9 pages. Two days ago, Denise read 15 pages, and Daniel read 7 pages. Yesterday, Denise read 10 pages while Daniel read 13 pages. Today, Denise read 5 more pages than what Daniel read yesterday, while Daniel did not read any pages today. The total pages they have read is one-fifth of the total number of pages in the book. How many total pages are there in the book?

There are 29 pupils in a class. The teacher has 9 coupons; each coupon can be redeemed for 100 bottles of apple juice. The teacher gives each student 2 bottles of apple juice to drink for lunch. After redeeming all her coupons and giving each student their apple juice for lunch, the teacher drinks 12 bottles of apple juice for herself. If one bottle of apple juice is worth $3.50, and the value of the remaining apple juice is one-third of her monthly salary, what is the teacher's monthly salary?

Darrell and Allen's ages are in the ratio of 7:11. If their total age now is 162, 10 years from now, Allen’s age will be 64 years older than John’s current age. John's wife, Mary, is 5 years younger than John. The average age of Mary and her daughter Eily is 29 years. How old is Eily now?

Claire makes a 3 egg omelet and one boiled egg every morning for breakfast, and she makes a bowl of noodle soup with 2 eggs every evening for dinner. If a dozen eggs cost $24, how much will she spend on eggs in 4 weeks?

My kitchen floor has a total area of 200 SqFt. I want to install new square floor tiles that cost $12 each, and each tile's side is 1ft in length. The installation worker's daily wage is $300, and the installation took 2 days. The total renovation cost of my kitchen floor is equal to a quarter of Mary's monthly salary. If one cake costs $24, how many cakes can Mary buy with her monthly salary?

Hannah needs to drink 100 ml of water for every 200 calories she burns. She spends 2 hours doing aerobics, which burns 500 calories per hour, 1 hour running, which burns 600 calories per hour, and 2 hours jumping rope, which burns 200 calories per hour. The price of water is $0.05 per ml. The money she spends on water is half of Mary's daily allowance. How much is Mary's daily allowance?

George, a grade six teacher, ordered 600 burritos for the sixth-grade class picnic. If there were 50 students at the picnic, and each student was given ten burritos, with Mr. George eating 20 of them, and 24 burritos were lost, calculate the total value of the leftover burritos given that each burrito costs 7 dollars. If the total value of the leftover burritos equals Mr. George's daily wage and he works 5 days a week, what is Mr. George's weekly salary?

Lindsay is doing the laundry, and thinks she has missed some socks. There are 50 socks that need washing. If she washes 10 pairs of socks and 15 loose socks, how many socks has Lindsay missed? The number of socks Lindsay missed is one-third the number of pants that need washing. The number of pants needing washing is five times the number of jackets that need washing. Later, Lindsay decides to send the clothes to a laundry service. If it costs $4 to wash one jacket, how much will it cost to wash all the jackets that need washing?

A company wanted to buy 500 computers and had $700 for each computer. However, when they went to order, they realized the price of each computer was 10% higher than they had planned for. They decided to buy 50 fewer computers than planned. The total amount of money they paid to purchase these computers was equal to one-third of the company's monthly revenue. If 20% of the company’s monthly revenue is spent on employee salaries, calculate the total amount of money given to employees for their monthly salary.

John has 10 hectares of a pineapple field. There are 100 pineapples per hectare. John can harvest his pineapples every 3 months. Each pineapple weighs 3 kilograms, and 1 kilogram of pineapples is valued at 5 dollars. The annual cost for John to cultivate pineapples is 30,000 dollars. What is John's profit from growing pineapples in a year?

A marketing company pays its employees on a commission-based salary system. If you sell goods worth $1000, you earn a 30% commission. Sales over $1000 get you an additional 10% commission. On Monday, Antonella sold goods worth $2500. On Tuesday, Antonella sold goods worth $1500. On Wednesday, Antonella sold goods worth $3500. On Thursday, Antonella sold goods worth $5000. Calculate the total amount of money Antonella earned over these four days.

Each pole on a road intersection has 4 street lights. If the number of poles at each intersection is 6, and the road has 4 intersections, calculate the total number of functioning street lights if 20 streetlights from the total number are not working. If each functioning street light consumes 7 kilowatt-hours of electricity per day and the electricity cost is $1.50 per kilowatt-hour, with a week being 7 days, calculate the total cost of electricity consumed by the functioning street lights for one week.

Joelle has 5 orchids, 4 African daisies, 6 roses, 3 lilies, and 5 tulips on her balcony. If the orchids have 5 petals each, the daisies have 10 petals each, the roses have 12 petals each, the lilies have 7 petals each, and the tulips have 8 petals each, how many petals are there in total?

John decides to get a loan by mortgaging his home. His house is worth $250,000. He gets a loan worth 40% of that. He uses 60% of that to pay off his debts. He spent $12,300 on a bicycle, bought 4 pieces of clothing at $78 each, and bought 6 pairs of shoes at $70 per pair. How much money did he have leftover after these expenses?

Errol bought a computer, 2 monitors, 3 keyboards, and a printer for $2,400. He paid $400 less for the printer than the computer, and each keyboard cost $100. If the computer cost $1,100 and the cost of one monitor is one-quarter of Errol's daily salary, Mary's daily salary is $130 less than Errol's. How much is Mary's daily salary?

A stickler for health, Octavia drinks half the daily recommended cups of coffee. By contrast, Octavia’s husband Juan drinks 10 times the amount of coffee she drinks. Juan’s doctor has asked him to reduce his coffee intake to the daily recommendation of 4 cups. At a cost of $4 per cup, the amount Juan will save daily by reducing his coffee intake is one-seventh of his daily wage. Assuming he works 5 days a week, what is Juan’s weekly wage?

Mary is two years younger than Joan, who is five years older than Jessa. John is four years older than Mary, Peter is ten years older than John, and Ellie is seven years younger than Peter. If Jessa is 20 years old, what is the sum of the ages of the six people?

Cherrie wants to buy Christmas gifts for her 5 friends. 2 of her friends want 5 gifts and the other 3 friends want 2 gifts for themselves. Cherrie goes ahead and buys them and decides to further surprise them by getting 10 more random gifts. Each gift costs $15, and the total money Cherrie spends on the gifts is half of her daily salary. A bicycle costs $4680. How many days of salary does Cherrie need to buy 1 bicycle?

Henry is making cookies for a local baking competition. He wants to make twice as many as he did last year. When he finishes baking, he realizes he actually baked 15 more cookies than he meant to. He drops 5 of his cookies as he is putting them out to cool, his brother eats 10 of the cookies, his sister eats twice the amount his brother ate, and his younger sister eats three times the amount his sister ate. Now he has a total of 110 cookies. How many cookies did Henry bake last year?

Shelly's 3 kids spent all day at the water park. Mitchel went down the water slide 30 times. Anne went down the slide 30% less than Mitchel, and Robert went down 4 times as much as Anne. Eily went down the slide 23 times less than Robert. Mary went down 11 times less than Eily. John went down the slide 1.5 times as much as Mary. How many times did John go down the water slide?

Jay is making snowballs to prepare for a snowball fight with his sister. He can build 20 snowballs in an hour, but 2 melt every 15 minutes. Jay wants to have 60 snowballs and his sister wants to have 36 snowballs. The time they spend making these snowballs is one-fifth of Jay's weekly working hours. If Jay earns $49 per hour, how much does he earn per week?

Mark works at his job for 8 hours a day for 5 days a week. He used to make $10 an hour but they raised his pay by $2 per hour. Now, he earns in one week what Mary earns in half a day. John earns $240 less than Mary in a day. How much does John make in a week?

Bennet is a farmer. He sells 20 of his eggplants for $3 each. He also sells 5 of his cabbages for $5 each. Furthermore, he has 25 ears of corn that he can sell. If Bennet wants to make a total of $135, each ear of corn must be sold for one-seventh the price of a watermelon. A winter melon costs $5 more than a watermelon. How much does one winter melon cost?

Jenny buys 1 bag of cookies a week. The bag has 36 cookies and she puts 4 cookies in her son's lunch box 5 days a week. Her husband eats 1 cookie a day for 7 days. Jenny eats the rest of the cookies. A cookie costs 3 dollars, and over a period of 9 weeks, the value of cookies Jenny eats is exactly one third the price of a bicycle. How much does the bicycle cost?

John injured his back and needs to go to physical therapy. He went to physical therapy for 6 weeks. Each week he went twice for 2 hours at a time. If the sessions cost $125 per hour, then the total cost of the physical therapy equals one-third of John's monthly salary. Mary's monthly salary is $2000 more than John's. Given there are 12 months in a year, how much does Mary earn in a year?

John and DeSean bought a bag of marshmallows to make s'mores together. The bag has 35 marshmallows. Each s'more uses one marshmallow. If John makes 9 s'mores, DeSean makes 9 s'mores, and they dropped 3 marshmallows on the ground, in addition, John ate 4 marshmallows, DeSean ate 6 marshmallows, and then they bought another 30 marshmallows. How many s'mores can each kid make with the remaining marshmallows in the bag?

May is getting her hair cut and colored. It costs $40 for the color and $30 per inch of haircut. If her hair started at 10 inches and ended at 8 inches, the total cost for her cut and color is a quarter of her daily wage. The average daily wage of May and Mary combined is $580. John earns $120 less than Mary per day. What is John's daily wage?

Cho hiked 14 kilometers per hour for 8 hours. Mary hiked twice the distance that Cho hiked. John hiked 100 kilometers less than Mary. Eily hiked three times the distance that John hiked. Chloe hiked 9 kilometers per hour and stopped after 5 hours. How many kilometers farther did Eily hike compared to Chloe?

A football team played 22 games. They won 8 more than they lost. Winning a game earns 3 points, and losing a game earns 1 point. Each point can be exchanged for 570 dollars. After exchanging all their points for dollars, they bought 3 washing machines, each costing 3470 dollars. How much money is left?
